#Text=Attract Parents to Your Daycare
#Text=Keeping your daycare or preschool at maximum enrollment is essential for the overall success of your center .
#Text=Word of mouth and positive reviews are powerful tools for attracting parents to your daycare .
#Text=However , you need to reach parents and grow your enrollment before you can take advantage of these assets .
#Text=When starting a new childcare center , use these steps to attract parents to your daycare .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Know your audience .
#Text=You may work with infants , toddlers and school-aged kids all day , but growing your center means seeking out parents .
#Text=Understanding the parents you ’re trying to reach will help you offer services and features that matter to them .
#Text=More than three-quarters of babies are now parented by millennials , the generation born between 1980 and 2000 .
#Text=To fill your daycare , you need to appeal to this new generation of parents .
#Text=Millennial parents love personalization , technology , and experiences ( rather than things ) .
#Text=Both moms and dads are more involved in decision-making when it comes to raising kids than in the past , so you need to create services that appeal to both parents .
#Text=More than ¾ of dads research parenting topics on YouTube .
#Text=Dads also rely on websites , social media , apps , and blogs to be better parents .
#Text=These are all places where your childcare center can connect with today ’s dads , using content marketing and digital ads .
#Text=Find your competitive advantage .
#Text=Nearby centers are competing to connect with the same audience .
#Text=To stand out , you need to identify what makes you different .
#Text=Why should moms and dads looking for the right daycare option choose you ?
#Text=First , take a look at what nearby centers are doing both on- and off-line .
#Text=Drive by local daycares and note what they look like from the outside .
#Text=Are they inviting ?
#Text=Does their sign make it easy for parents to find them ?
#Text=Is their playground protected from busy streets and passersby ?
#Text=Then , turn to Google .
#Text=Search using phrases parents would use , like “ daycare centers near me . ”
#Text=Go through the first few pages of search results for approximately 10 unique phrases you think parents would search with .
#Text=Click on websites and make notes of what first impression your competitors are leaving online .
#Text=You should also spend some time brainstorming the strengths and weaknesses of businesses that are n’t direct competitors but could still appeal to local parents looking for childcare .
#Text=Examples include summer camps , nannies and in-home daycares .
#Text=After reviewing the competition , think about what makes your childcare business different from these other local businesses .
#Text=These are the features you should highlight when looking to attract parents to your daycare .
#Text=Whether you ’re focused on education , offer extended hours or have highly-qualified teachers , own it !
#Text=Build your brand .
#Text=Build a brand around your competitive advantage and the audience you want to connect with .
#Text=Your brand , or “ personality , ” includes a logo , colors , fonts , tone of voice , tagline and other elements that help parents immediately recognize your center .
#Text=Use these brand elements consistently in every place you are connecting with parents , like your physical center , business cards , flyers , social media profiles , and website .
#Text=Advertise your daycare .
#Text=Advertising helps you put your daycare in front of parents who may be looking for childcare .
#Text=Consider where your audience ( identified in Step 1 ) spends time .
#Text=Millennial parents search for parenting advice and service reviews online , so this is one of the first places you should advertise .
#Text=A website is a great starting point .
#Text=All of your other advertising , both online and off , should point toward your website , where you have unlimited space to talk about what makes your center great .

#Text=Online advertising tools include paid and organic social media ( Facebook , Twitter , LinkedIn , Instagram , Pinterest , YouTube , etc. ) , content marketing , search engine optimization , email marketing , search ads , and display ads .
#Text=Offline , consider flyers , lawn signs , car magnets , and community partnerships and events .
#Text=Make sure all of your advertising , both traditional and digital , includes your competitive advantages and brand elements .
#Text=Turn leads into customers .
#Text=Your advertising will encourage parents to call to learn more , fill out a contact form on your website or sign up for a tour .
#Text=Once you have contact information for a family interested in your center , they are considered a lead .
#Text=To fill your daycare or preschool , you need to turn these leads into enrollments .
#Text=You want to attract parents to your daycare and reassure nervous moms and dads that you are the right place for their child .
#Text=A thorough tour , friendly and knowledgeable staff , open communication , modern facility and positive reputation are what it takes to turn leads into customers .
